text:
Sometimes an entity is created solely for the purpose of owning specific assets and
issuing bonds to provide the funds to purchase the assets. These entities are referred to as
special purpose entities (SPEs) in the United States and special purpose vehicles (SPVs)
in Europe. Bonds issued by these entities are called securitized bonds. As an example, a
firm could sell loans it has made to customers to an SPE that issues bonds to purchase
the loans. The interest and principal payments on the loans are then used to make the
interest and principal payments on the bonds.
